metadata.title: CVE-2018-5389 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description: The Internet Key Exchange v1 main mode is vulnerable to offline dictionaryor brute force attacks. Reusing a key pair across different versions andmodes of IKE could lead to cross-protocol authentication bypasses. It iswell known, that the aggressive mode of IKEv1 PSK is vulnerable to offlinedictionary or brute force attacks. For the main mode, however, only anonline attack against PSK authentication was thought to be feasible. Thisvulnerability could allow an attacker to recover a weak Pre-Shared Key orenable the impersonation of a victim host or network.

criterions.comment: libreswan: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
strongswan: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
isakmpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
